title: Invariant Tori and Periodic Orbits in the FitzHugh-Nagumo System
authors: Murilo R. C\^andido, Douglas D. Novaes, Nasrin Sadri
abstract:
The FitzHugh-Nagumo system is a $4$-parameter family of $3$D vector field
used for modeling neural excitation and nerve impulse propagation. The origin
represents a Hopf-zero equilibrium in the FitzHugh-Nagumo system for two
classes of parameters. In this paper, we employ recent techniques in averaging
theory to investigate, besides periodic solutions, the bifurcation of invariant
tori within the aforementioned families. We provide explicit generic conditions
for the existence of these tori and analyze their stability properties.
Furthermore, we employ the backward differentiation formula to solve the stiff
differential equations and provide numerical simulations for each of the
mentioned results.
